response_parsed.title: Implementing Serverless Handlers Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide provides a comprehensive overview of implementing serverless functions using FastAPI, a modern, high-performance web framework for building APIs in Python 3.12+.
key_points: FastAPI is built upon the popular Starlette web framework and supports async/await for performance optimization.
It provides automatic generation of OpenAPI documentation, making it easier to understand and work with APIs.
Supports serverless deployment on AWS Lambda (via Serverless Framework) and other platforms like Vercel and Heroku.
FastAPI's built-in features include type hinting, route level validation, and more.
Python 3.12+ is required for some advanced features, such as the new match-operator.

code_examples.code: pip install fastapi[all] && pip install --upgrade uvicorn[standard] && cd my_project && uvicorn app:app --host 0.0.0.0 --port 8000

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for some features, such as the new match-operator.
FastAPI requires FastAPI[all] package installation and recommends uvicorn[standard].
caveats: While FastAPI supports serverless deployment on various platforms, it's important to understand their specific requirements and limitations for optimal usage.
Ensure you have the appropriate AWS Lambda layers configured when deploying to AWS Lambda.
